review_text: I stayed at the Nook for 5 nights, attending a conference at at RICC and RISD, so the location was convenient for me. Kevin was responsive and quick to answer my questions before and during my trip and greeted me in the morning to show me the way to the apartment. The small space is well utilized and organized, stocked with many basics in the kitchenette and bathroom- the only thing I needed and couldnâ€™t find was a pair of scissors. It would be a cozy fit for two people, especially as the bed is only accessible from one side and the bathroom has a sliding door without a handle, or one I could find. I love the reading nook, fresh flowers and plants throughout that made it feel homey. As someone sensitive to noise and light a sleep mask, earplugs and a mini sound machine was helpful to block out street noise and the lights that are always on inside the Arcade. Other than a fire alarm my first day when I was trying to nap, my stay was pleasant and it felt like a tiny home away from home

There are nice shops and places to eat right downstairs, as well as many good restaurants, bars, and shops within a few short blocks. The description and photos are accurate: this place is small. Don't get me wrong, it is a great home-base for a short stay in Providence, but it is a microapartment. review_text:
Overall would recommend. lots to do in the area/withing walking distance. The amtrak train station is a 10 min walk away.
Pros:
- Phenomenal location.
- Easy access to train station, cafes, and restaurants.
- Located above several small cafes.
- Quiet ambiance for most of the day./not loud at night.
- Elevator access.
Cons:
- Matress is very firm and depending on preferences may be difficult to sleep on.
- No parking for building. There is a parking lot across the street that charges $22/day and is flexible (i.e., you can go in and out of garage and pay for the day). The garage only provides 2 day passes so you will need to renew the parking pass every 2 days. It would be more budget friendly to use public transportation than rent/bring a car.

The apartment is located just 8 minutes from the train station and within a few minutes to some of the best restaurants in town including the many located on the first floor of the Arcade. There is a nice communal lounge with laundry downstairs and great coffee place.
The apartment is located on a fairly quiet side street, but itâ€™s possible to walk to the center of town with shops and more restaurants in less than 10 minutes. The iconic Superman Building towers the Arcade on Westminster Street and was truly cool to see in person. The architecture of the Arcade and surrounding buildings was a great experience.
I will be back.

review_text:
As a hockey writer who travels a lot, I was very pleased with Kevin's rental at the Arcade in downtown Providence. Close enough to get to the Amica Bank Pavillion and close enough to get back to get some work done in a quiet environment.
I was extremely pleased with the cleanliness of the rental and the location to unwind with so many excellent bars and restaurants within walking distance.
Kevin was a fantastic host and explained everything I needed to know about the rental, the easiest way to get around the massive building, and emergency evacuation details.
I hope Kevin's rental is available the next time I travel to Rhode Island to cover the Providence Bruins as a media member.
I highly recommend staying here if you're traveling to this great area of New England.
Mark A.

Great location without being in one of those large hotel conglomerates. Kevin has made a space that maybe just the same size (or smaller) feel perfect. The room has a way that makes you feel welcome but still has that comfort space when needed. The room has everything a person could need. It was great for 1 person would be ok for 2.
The location is quiet. For being in a "mall" I heard no one else. I had music playing that couldn't be heard outside the door and except NYE nothing too bad from outside the windows. When looking out the Windows it is primarily a parking lot which gives you space to see around you. You look at the buildings that make up the Providence skyline.
When you step out of the building you are in the heart of Providence. Steps away from plenty of places to eat, including the ones inside the place. Perfect for exploring the architecture of this great town. I felt safe walking everywhere I went.
Kevin's pregame help really helped make the important decisions but leave time to read a book in the nook especially page 85 in the architecture book.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: My husband and I chose Anya's and Alex's place as our 3 nights stay in Providence and we don't regret it. The location was quite convenient. It takes 15 min walk to get to the bus stops to/from the airport, as well as the train station. *By the way, a little tip - if you want to get to Boston by MBTA train, it costs only $10 on the weekends and the rides are unlimited, means you can ride there and back as many times as you want*. Self check-in/check out were very smooth. The room itself was nice, well decorated and clean. My husband said the mattress was good (it matters to him). We lived on the 2nd floor and it was warm enough there (it matters to me). Common areas as kitchen and 2 bathrooms were always clean and well equipped. However, the bathroom on the 1st floor was a bit too cold for me (month of March). There were not many people living there at the same time, so it felt private. The street was quiet even on Friday and Saturday evening. Shortly say,I recommend this place!

We were lucky enough to have the upstairs to ourselves since the other 2 rooms werenâ€™t rented out so that was nice. A group of girls rented the downstairs room so we had our own levels of the house to ourselves! Made it so much easier and covid free friendly! Every room has their own lock and key, Anya and Alex left plenty of notes around the house making our stay THAT MUCH EASIER! Federal hill is just walking distance to so many cute and unique bars with the best authentic Italian grocery stores. Thereâ€™s plenty of parking available as well! I appreciate how well they paid attention to details with this Airbnb and we definitely plan to come back in the future. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

review_text:
Loved our stay at Anya & Alex's place. I would highly recommend this place and come back again. Here is our nutshell:
Positives:
- Cleanliness. It was really well maintained, kudos to the cleaning staff.
- Coffee machine. I was working for 3 of the days and having a coffee machine at home was a lifesaver
- Wifi is ample quick
- Communication from the host
- Fantastic location
Bad:
There isn't really any but if I have to be nit-picky, I would say the squeaky noise wood makes when you walk. It is particularly noticeable in the upstair bedrooms (like the one we stayed)
Shared bathroom wasn't really a problem as there are 2 units in the house. This isn't necessarily a fancy BnB but they got all the basics right and that's what I look for when I travel.

review_text: The location was fantastic in terms of being able to walk pretty much anywhere within 20 minutes. there were some outstanding food venues within a 5 to 10 minute walk and the convention center was about 15 minutes away. The apartment itself was simply decorated but had just about everything you could need. The one item I do wish it had was a washer dryer setup, but there was a laundromat within a 2-minute walk of the apartment. One thing to keep in mind is that it's a slightly older building so it's pretty easy to hear people walking around in the other apartments, especially at night when it's quiet. It wasn't a big deal and a noise maker is provided to help with the problem, but if it's something you're sensitive to then it might be a bigger deal. Overall I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

review_text:
Jenniferâ€™s place was beautiful and in pristine condition. I primarily chose it for the outdoor space, but it was too cold to spend quality time out there during our time there. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. While we didnâ€™t cook, she did have plenty of items needed - pots, pans, dishes, drink ware, and silverware. She also had a coffee pot with coffee ready to go. (Dishwasher, too!)
We really also loved that there was a parking spot for our one vehicle. Jennifer was EXTREMELY clear in providing us directions to the lot and overall checkin.
Some things to keep in mind, depending on why you are visiting:
- itâ€™s about a .4-.5 mile walk to Atwells, a great strip with wonderful restaurant
- you canâ€™t have more than two people inside the apartment at any time - this turned out fine because we were able to meet with our friend for dinner instead, but keep that in mind.
- pick up some water, as the tap is unfiltered
- thereâ€™s an iron and bath towels
- the WFH room is huge!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I had a very comfortable stay at Alexey's place from a Friday evening to a Sunday morning (2 nights). The apartment was very comfortable and clean with plenty of space. The bed was comfortable and it was great having access to a full kitchen.
I did not meet Alexey in person, but he was friendly and responsive electronically, and checkin was very straightforward. The location had good bus service via RIPTA and I was able to get to downtown (and to the Brown University campus) by Lyft in under 10 minutes. There were a couple adequate food and grocery options in a less than 10 minute walk that Alexey suggested, and his suggestions were on the mark.
The bathroom was shared with 2 other guest rooms but this was fine for my stay since the other guests were considerate.
And my stay was a great value. I would stay again.

I had a great stay!

Another thing I have to mention is that I didn't find parking one night when I returned from work because another guest had taken two spots. Lovely place, very easy check-in -- there's a combination lock on the outer door and on the door to your room and everyone gets their own code for that visit. There's wifi, naturally, and it's a quiet neighborhood.
Be sure to read the listing carefully. There are several rooms listed here, one (some?) of which have off-street parking and some of which do not. There's no street parking or garages in the area, so if you don't get the off-street parking one(s) then you'll need to park a ways off and hike / Uber / mass transit in.

Everything was as described:
-Good value for the room
-The sheets were crazy soft
-Had some pots, pans, etc. which was nice
-Building was clean
Random Comments:
-The building is next to a relatively noisy street, but Alexey provided earplugs though, so no big deal.
-The neighborhood isn't phenomenal, but having off-street driveway parking makes it not a big deal.
-Alexey didn't lie, the driveway is tight, so make sure your car is small otherwise you're parking on the street.
-Never met Alexey. Condo is ran like a hostel, which is no big deal if you're not interested in the host/guest experience. You just kind of show-up, go inside, go to your locked room.

It was easy to find & a seamless check in process as outlined clearly in her instructions. The surround streets are very cute with a variety of shops, bars & restaurants.
The apartment looks exactly like the photos and is impeccably well appointed, clean and thoughtful. I really appreciated the kitchen which was fully equipped with things like a rice cooker, measuring cups, good quality pots & pans for meals during our stay. There were ample plugs strategically placed throughout the home, well placed lighting, wifi, extra linens, cleaning supplies, stain remover near the washer/dryer unit, instructions throughout and even ear plugs (which we didn't need). Nora and her family thought of everything!
I'd stay here again in a heartbeat and highly reccomend her location to anyone visiting the Providence area.

review_text:
We stayed for almost a full week. Norahâ€™s place was great. Exactly what we needed! Norah is super responsive too.
LOCATION: We wanted to be downtown near everything, it was a perfect location. Providence is super walkable and has tons of restaurants and cafes.
AMENITIES: The place had everything we needed; backup lines, a washer/dryer, kitchen necessities, etc. Bed was SO comfortable. I slept so well.
NOISE: The noise from downstairs is trueâ€” you can hear the deep bass from the music. It kept me up a little bit but my partner was fine. It helped to put in earplugs (provided) and turn on one of the box fans (also provided). Also, it only played on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday night. Every other night it was quiet.
* One downside is that right out the windows is a parking garage; so not much of a view. But other than that, exactly as described.
* Iâ€™d also recommend that they put some more â€œhomeyâ€ touches on the place, like rugs, maybe some more art. It didnâ€™t feel super cozy.

There were also a number of board games available and a large desk in the bedroom that would be a great work-from-home setup. We ended up leaving our car in the Biltmore garage for 2 days, which cost $70. A little pricier than I would have liked, but worth it for the convenience! We would definitely stay here again

The apartment was well-furnished and stocked for my stay, and a short walk from the train station (MBTA/Amtrak), the river (for WaterFire), and plenty of nearby restaurants. I ended up finding street parking fairly easily though the Biltmore Garage was also a block away. Iâ€™d stay here again!

Sadly, an unfortunate event demanded their return home two days after their arrival, and upon my informing Norah of the early departure, she replied with a totally unanticipated gift: she refunded two nights of the booking. Familiar with the rental policy as I was, it hadn't entered my mind to ask whether she might consider any refund or credit; this was entirely her idea. Norah's kindness and generosity brightened the derailed holiday!

review_text: Norah's home was lovely, clean and spacious for two, had a bunch of amenities and good wifi for working, and was in a great location (walking distance from all the main areas). Free parking was possible (we got lucky with street parking that didn't have meters, and there are several streets that don't have signs), but otherwise there's a parking structure around the block and metered street parking everywhere. For laundry, there's an in-unit washer/dryer combo machine, but the dryer part wasn't the best. However, there is a laundry room (that uses quarters) on the same floor that is available 24hours -- worked well for us. Overall, would recommend Norah's home!

Parking was right behind the apartment and could be accessed from a back door which made unloading your vehicle about 10 steps away. Coffee shop was right across the street and had great coffee and sandwiches. There is a pizza place next store called hotline pizza, which only takes orders online at set up time slots (I highly recommend). Julians is a block away with a great breakfast and lunch special. Also, about 3 blocks behind the building is Atwells Ave. with about 20 different restaurants. In sum, great location, apartment, host and experience.
Thank you Aref

The place was lovely and clean with a coffee shop right across the road. My only problem was that it was almost winter and the outside temperature went down to 32 at the night. I figured out how to turn the thermostat on, but maybe others may not. This heated up the main room very quickly and well. However, the bedrooms remained icy even though I found the floor vents. My friend ended up sleeping on the sofa in the front room to a) stay warm and b) get away from an extremely noisy and annoying generator or something right outside. I was annoyed by it as well but had brought earplugs. There was a vibration associated with whatever the thing was. I imagine that in the Spring and Summer, none of this would be a problem.
It's a really beautiful space and a fascinating walkable neighbourhood with terrific and interesting architectural bits and pieces on the houses. The Nitro coffee shop (and bicycle shop) is right across the road and everyone there was incredibly friendly

Where to begin, I stayed with Collin and Jen in one of the rooms on the second floor of their beautiful home! Their home is absolutely stunning! They went above and beyond to make sure I was comfortable during my stay. The house was exactly as it described in the listing! It was actually more beautiful in person; you just have to experience it for yourself! It has everything you may need for a comfortable stay. Washer/dryer, full kitchen and living area and a great bathroom with a SPA TUB that works amazing! The apartment feels like a large home even though it is an apartment. The attention to details in the design of the home are incredible! It is set up to make you feel right at "home".
Collin and Jen were beyond amazing and kind! Anything that was needed was done immediately! They respond quickly to your needs. I was able to experience a wonderful social event that was held and the apartment! Food, drinks and good vibes! There is beautiful art and photos all over the home! 10/10!

review_text: Cozy room in a spacious home. Nothing fancy but great value, would stay again. Each room and floor has itâ€™s own lock (in addition to the front door), so felt safe living in the shared space. Loved seeing all of Colin's photographs on the walls. At first, I was looking for somewhere that was more walkable to downtown Providence, but this location proved to be excellent. It's a 10 min walk to Atwells Ave which has plenty of restaurants, and a 5 min walk to some great bars (The Avery, Ogie's Trailer Park). You MUST try Tricycle Ice Cream which was also less than a 5 min walk from here!

Stayed with kids
review_text: Very nice apartment with a great kitchen, amazing photography (the host Colin is an award-winning photographer with his work all over the house - some for sale), nice furniture, comfortable bed, and great location! Our flat mates were up at 5am and banging around a little as they left but we went back to sleep quickly after. It was to be expected with an apartment share - kind of fun to be in sort of a hostel. Just wish the place were a little cleaner. Regardless, everything was functional and comfortable and I would stay again for the location and value.
